channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Sun, 08 Sep 2024 12:41:21 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Harry still has an anchor in the UK’: Prince’s 'secret' connection with family members
item.description: Prince Harry remains in touch with his late mother Princess Diana's family despite estrangement from Prince William and King Charles. He attended Lady Jane Fellowes' husband's funeral and stayed at Althorp House with uncle Charles Spencer. Additionally, he maintains a good relationship with cousin Princess Beatrice, who is mediating between him and William.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President Biden spent 532 days away from office, took 48 years worth of leave in 4 years
item.description: US President Joe Biden has spent 532 days on vacation in less than four years, far exceeding his predecessors. Critics argue that his frequent absences neglect key issues such as inflation and border security. While aides assert he works remotely during vacations, public images of him relaxing have sparked debate about balancing presidential duties with personal time off.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Venezuelan opposition ex-Presidential candidate fled the country: Key details
item.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez has sought asylum in Spain after hiding due to an arrest warrant following disputed presidential election results favoring Nicolás Maduro. Venezuela granted him safe conduct to leave the country, emphasizing adherence to international law and aiming for political peace amid ongoing diplomatic tensions with Brazil.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia shooter suspect's mother called school minutes before shooting, warned of ‘extreme emergency’
item.description: Marcee Gray alerted a school counselor about her son Colt before the Georgia school shooting occurred. A text message from Colt led Marcee to contact the school. The shooting at Apalachee High School resulted in four fatalities and nine injuries. Both Colt and his father are facing serious legal charges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Australia's 2026 census to include LGBTIQ+ identity questions following public outrage
item.description: For the first time, Australia's 2026 census will include optional questions on sexual orientation and gender for individuals aged 16 and above. This decision follows controversy over their initial exclusion. Government officials emphasise that this change aims to ensure representation of the LGBTIQ+ community, reflecting their importance in national statistics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese man dies after working for 104 days with 1 day off, company held liable
item.description: A'bao, a 30-year-old painter, succumbed to multiple organ failure after an exhausting work schedule of 104 days with only one day off. The court ruled that the company was 20% responsible and ordered compensation for his family. His work conditions violated Chinese Labour Law's regulations on working hours.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘We're run by stupid people’: Trump calls for Constitutional change to remove 'conspiring' vice presidents
item.description: Donald Trump proposed amending the 25th Amendment to remove a vice president who covers up a president's incapacity. This call was made during a campaign rally in Wisconsin, in response to Joe Biden's poor debate performance and his subsequent withdrawal from the presidential race, which left Kamala Harris as the Democratic nominee.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Raging wildfire forces evacuations in US' San Bernardino as temperatures cross triple digits
item.description: A wildfire in the San Bernardino National Forest near Los Angeles has prompted evacuations as temperatures hit 112°F. The Line Fire, igniting Thursday evening, has burned through 11 square miles of vegetation. Over 500 firefighters are on the scene with air support. Officials warn of potential significant fire growth within the next 12 hours.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US believes Iran has transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia
item.description: The US believes Iran has transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia for its war in Ukraine, raising concerns about escalating conflict and European security threats. The White House reiterates warnings against such transfers, while Iran denies supplying weapons, calling for a ceasefire instead. CIA Director highlights troubling defense relationships involving Russia, China, Iran, and North Korea.

item.title: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump to face off in first debate: What are the rules?
item.description: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump will face off in their first direct debate on September 10. Hosted by ABC News at the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia, the 90-minute event includes timed responses and muted microphones to ensure smooth proceedings. The debate will be broadcast nationwide without a live audience.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk reveals SpaceX’s ambitious plan to send uncrewed starships to Mars: What we know
item.description: Elon Musk announced that SpaceX will launch the first uncrewed Starships to Mars in two years, aiming to test their landing reliability. If successful, crewed missions will follow in four years. The ultimate objective is to build a self-sustaining city on Mars within approximately 20 years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iranian Secret Service agents detained in France for Europe-wide plot to kill Jews
item.description: Abdelkrim S and Sabrina B have been charged by a Paris court for their alleged roles in Iranian-backed assassination plots targeting Jews in Germany and France. The couple is accused of conspiring with a terrorist organisation and is currently held in pre-trial detention. Investigations also connect them to arson attempts on Israeli-owned businesses.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Multiple people shot along highway in US state of Kentucky, hunt for 'armed' suspect on
item.description: In southern Kentucky, a segment of Interstate 75 highway was closed following a shooting incident that left multiple people injured. Authorities are searching for suspect Joseph Couch, deemed armed and dangerous. The Laurel County Sheriff's Office and Kentucky State Police have advised residents to stay indoors during the ongoing hunt for the suspect.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia school shooting suspect Colt Gray lived in several rental homes prior to the incident
item.description: Colt Gray, a 14-year-old suspect, along with his father Colin, faces charges for killing two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School in Georgia. The family had relocated multiple times after Colin's divorce. Colt struggled with bullying and his parents' separation. He is being tried as an adult for the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry set to receive major inheritance after he turns 40. He will get ...
item.description: Prince Harry is set to receive around £8 million from a family trust fund on his 40th birthday, September 15. Established by his great-grandmother in 1994, the fund aims to provide financial gifts to her great-grandchildren. This financial boost adds to the couple's growing wealth from deals with Spotify, Netflix, and a book contract.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US MQ-9 drone shot down by Houthis in Yemen's Marib governorate
item.description: The Iran-aligned Houthi group claimed responsibility for shooting down a US MQ-9 drone over Marib governorate, Yemen, alleging it was engaged in hostile activities. This incident aligns with ongoing Houthi attacks on shipping vessels in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden, as they demand an end to the Israel-Hamas conflict in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia school shooting: How bullying and family struggles led to tragedy that killed four
item.description: A 14-year-old boy and his father face charges for a fatal shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia that killed four people. The case underscores the teenager's troubled home life, persistent bullying, and his father's role in giving him access to firearms. Both appeared in court for the first time in September 2023.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In a first, Pakistan Army chief admits its direct role in 1999 Kargil war
item.description: Pakistan army chief General Asim Munir has admitted his military's direct involvement in the 1999 Kargil War against India, ending a long-standing claim that only indigenous Kashmiri rebels fought. He honoured Pakistani soldiers killed in the conflict and acknowledged their sacrifices in previous wars for the country and Islam.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: A street artist documents war in Ukraine, one stark mural at a time
item.description: Ukrainian street artist Gamlet Zinkivskyi joined a volunteer unit to defend Kharkiv but was advised by his commander to paint instead. His murals in bombed-out streets depict wartime realities and boost morale among soldiers and civilians. Despite widespread appreciation, some of his work has faced criticism for its themes.

item.title: Pakistani man charged over alleged plot to attack New York City Jewish centre around October 7
item.description: Pakistani citizen Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, living in Canada, has been arrested for planning an attack on a Jewish center in New York City. Scheduled for October 2024, the attack aimed to kill as many Jewish people as possible in support of the Islamic State. Khan faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted.
